curam.util.client.domain.render
Interface DomainRenderer

All Superinterfaces:
ComponentRenderer<Field>, DomainPlugIn, PlugIn
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractDomainRenderer, AbstractEditRenderer, AbstractSelectRenderer, AbstractViewRenderer
public interface DomainRenderer
extends DomainPlugIn, ComponentRenderer<Field>

A domain renderer is a ComponentRenderer for domain-specific Field components. It produces the markup used to represent a values in a domain on an application page. Typically, this produces the XHTML that is inserted into the page where a field is to appear. Custom renderer plug-in implementations should not implement this interface directly. Instead, they should extend on of the sub-classes of the AbstractDomainRenderer class. See that class for more details.

Field Summary
static java.lang.String EDIT_PLUG_IN_NAME
          The name of this type of domain plug-in when used to render input controls for editing or creating values.
static java.lang.String SELECT_PLUG_IN_NAME
          The name of this type of domain plug-in when used to render input controls for selecting values from a list of available options.
static java.lang.String VIEW_PLUG_IN_NAME
          The name of this type of domain plug-in when used to render values for viewing on a page.
